column4: Oh, and also, if I do Ctrl-Alt-Del, the screen fades out.  If I do Ctrl-Alt-Del again, I see a "unlock screen" windows.  I can type in the window and unlock the screen.
if your menus and panels are missing try opening terminal  and type   xfce4-panel
Any idea how to open a terminal?
alt+f2
Hmm... I don't think that worked for me.. I can try again...
(I mean Alt-F2 didn't seem to switch screens)
alt+f2 should pop up a box called Run Application
But thanks for the xfce4_panel tip.
Ah!
Thanks, that sounds like a good guess.  I'm going to have to leave irc to try this.  xfce4_panel was the command you recommend?  With no flags?
xfce4-panel   with no flags
Thanks; I'll give that a go.  Thanks all; hopefully I'll sign in again with a working X...
legend: It worked!
good but unfortunately next time you reboot they may disappear again
Thanks!  I don't know why xfce4-panel did not start up, but typing it in a terminal brought it back up.
good but unfortunately next time you reboot they may disappear again
legened2440: Right; I'll try to figure out what happened.  But at least I can switch windows now and use firefox, etc.
read third post from bottom by Billi this is how he got xfce-panel to start on boot    http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-415082.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xfce4-panel/+bug/53897 mentions the same issue I ran into.
just curious why you don't just use Gnome instead?
Because I didn't know any better at the time; I was seeking a light-weight easy-to-use distro.  This system is circa 2002.
I may indeed switch the window manager to gnome at this point, though.
ok wel if you wanted to try Gnome you can follow instructions on this page for removing xubuntu and installing Gnome   http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/puregnome
Thanks again.
